Detailed Description

Represents a file in the content library.

Represents a file in the content library that can be loaded/imported. Also provides functionality for moving the file to a new location, renaming the file, and deleting the file from the library.

See also:
DzContentFolder

Member Function Documentation

bool DzContentFile::deleteFile (  )  [slot]

Removes this file from its content folder. The default implementation of this function deletes the content file and any associated thumbnail image from the disk, so use with care!

Returns:
true if the file was removed successfully.
QString DzContentFile::getCompanionPath (  )  const
Returns:
A string that represents the full path to the actual folder.

Property Documentation

bool DzContentFile::canDelete [read]
Returns:
true if the file can be deleted.
bool DzContentFile::canRename [read]
Returns:
true if the file can be renamed.
bool DzContentFile::companionIsScript [read]
Returns:
true if this is a non-native file that has a companion file and the companion file is a DAZ Script.
bool DzContentFile::hasCompanion [read]
Returns:
true if this is a non-native file and a DAZ Script or Native File with the same basename exists in the same directory.
bool DzContentFile::hasCompanionScript [read]
Returns:
true if this is a non-native file and a DAZ Script with the same basename exists in the same directory.
bool DzContentFile::isNative [read]
Returns:
true if this is a native DAZ Studio file.
bool DzContentFile::isScript [read]
Returns:
true if this is a native DAZ Studio script file.
